questions.question: What is channel bonding?
questions.explanation: Bonding: wider channels. Purpose: increase bandwidth. Channels: 20, 40, 80, 160 MHz. Interference: reduced space available. Trade-off: capacity vs coverage. Importance: bandwidth optimization.

questions.question: What is a channel?
questions.explanation: Channel: frequency range. 2.4 GHz: 14 channels possible. 5 GHz: many channels. Overlap: channels 1, 6, 11 recommended. Interference: channels too close. Importance: interference management.

questions.question: What is channel interference?
questions.explanation: Interference: overlapping channels. Cause: nearby APs same frequency. Effect: reduced speed. Solution: use different channels. Tool: WiFi scanner. Importance: performance issue.

questions.question: What is WPA2 (WiFi Protected Access)?
questions.explanation: WPA2: security standard. Encryption: AES. Authentication: PSK or enterprise. Current: widely used. Replacement: WPA3 emerging. Importance: wireless security.

questions.question: What is WPA3?
questions.explanation: WPA3: latest standard. Security: improved encryption. Protection: against brute force. Adoption: slowly rolling. Benefit: stronger security. Importance: future standard.

questions.question: What is a BSSID?
questions.explanation: BSSID: basic service set ID. Format: MAC address. Uniqueness: per AP. Scanning: devices see BSSID. Purpose: device identification. Importance: AP tracking.

questions.question: What is roaming?
questions.explanation: Roaming: client switches AP. Connection: maintained across APs. Same network: SSID identical. Seamless: best case. Importance: mobility feature.

questions.question: What is a mesh network?
questions.explanation: Mesh: APs relay traffic. Benefit: wider coverage. Seamless: roaming automatic. Speed: slower than wired. Technology: modern routers. Importance: coverage improvement.

questions.question: What is WiFi Direct?
questions.explanation: Direct: peer-to-peer connection. No AP: needed intermediary. Purpose: file transfer, printing. Speed: fast. Importance: device connectivity.

questions.question: What is MIMO?
questions.explanation: MIMO: multiple antennas. Benefit: increased speed, range. Receive: multiple paths. 802.11n/ac: standard feature. Importance: performance enhancement.
